data.text:
If you were part of a recent #layoff, were #laidoff and are a #jobseeker #opentowork never fear! There are lots of #hotjobs available!! Check out this new #jobposting with DaVita Kidney Care! I can help you navigate your search with my 19 years of experience in the industry and as a #resumewriter. I can prepare a strong ATS friendly resume to get you results and get you back to work QUICKLY! There is a lot more competition with the recent #layoffs, so it‚Äôs even more important you stand out from the competition, and you have a proven job search strategy. How I can help you: ‚Ä¢ Customized resume preparation- taking the time to thoroughly understand your expertise, not just providing a basic questionnaire or mass-produced ‚Äúcookie-cutter‚Äù resume template. ‚Ä¢ LinkedIn profile preparation/optimization. ‚Ä¢ Job search coaching to walk you step-by-step through the process so you aren‚Äôt aimlessly applying to jobs and not getting responses. ‚Ä¢ Freelance Recruiter with a vast network of hiring manager/recruiter contacts to connect you to. 94 of my clients accepted offers for new jobs in 2023 already, 124 in 2021 and 112 in 2022! One obtained a $70K increase in her previous salary, one DOUBLED his salary, one a $50K increase, one a $55K increase and another a $35K increase! Visit my 118+ LinkedIn recommendations of success stories. One recent client‚Äôs success story-- ‚ÄúI went from constant rejection to averaging 6 interviews a week almost overnight.‚Äù Please take advantage of my FREE RESUME REVIEW offer on my website. https://lnkd.in/g-4bcFV ‚ÄúRemember you only get one chance to make a first impression, make it a Professional Impression!!‚Äù #careercoach #resumewriter #ono

I've discovered a gem in the surgical services world. Meet Director of Surgical Services- RN, BSN, MBA, CNOR, LSSGB - 11+ years of progressive leadership experience - Currently: Director of Surgical Services at a major cancer hospital - Manages $897M in annual revenue across 33 ORs and 8 IR labs Top 5 Career Highlights: 1. Opened a new ambulatory surgery center, managing all aspects from staffing to equipment 2. Achieved 90% block utilization and 92% OR utilization 3. Rebuilt OR staffing model, presenting to senior leadership 4. Led a team of 210+ FTEs across multiple surgical departments 5. Implemented Lean practices and Kaizen for staff engagement Are you struggling to find experienced surgical services leaders who can drive efficiency, manage large teams, and boost revenue? This candidate might be the solution you've been searching for. The pain is real: - Shortage of qualified healthcare executives - Need for leaders who understand both clinical and business sides - Difficulty finding candidates with proven track records in large, complex health systems The director of surgical services is open to new opportunities in the $170k-$200k range and is willing to relocate for the right position. If you're a CNO, CEO, or VP of Surgical Services looking for top-tier talent, let's connect. My candidate could be the missing piece in your leadership puzzle. #HealthcareLeadership #SurgicalServices #TalentAcquisition #NursingLeadership

Quit after 1 day! I had an interesting exchange over text message yesterday. With all of the recent news and stories showcasing the challenges in community pharmacy, I reached to a few colleagues I go waaaaaay back with. One in particular mentioned they had lost 7 techs in the last few months. There is an important concept to understand here. It requires some self reflection and can be a bitter pill to swallow. People don't leave companies. People leave leaders. Yes, there are some downright terrible companies out there. But there are also a lot of people who work for bad companies. What keeps them there? Their leader does. Perhaps you have encountered a scenario where support staff will not work with certain pharmacists. "If <pharmacist A> is going to be here tomorrow, I am not." I have heard countless stories along these lines. People don't leave companies, they leave leaders. It is one thing to see this with someone else, it is a completely other thing to see this in yourself. It hurts. It hurts deeply. Things are burning down around you, and now you have even less help. When I first started scheduling pharmacists, it took less than 72 hours for the first pharmacist to give his notice. At the time, I was naive enough to think it was just the ways things were. And sometimes it is. Sometimes a family must move or sometimes a new addition to the family creates a situation that requires more flexibility. I have learned to never fault someone for making choices that brings a better situation for their family. But I have also learned to become a better leader. I had a very small clinical team and we were doing big things. We were training thousands of pharmacists for various activities and making good progress. Then I got a call. A member of my team was giving notice. Up to that point, I thought I was a good leader. I probably arrogantly thought I was an above average leader. Reflecting on how I handled my team member's departure, I can now see how horrible of a leader I was. People don't leave companies, they leave leaders. With all of the challenges that pharmacy faces, the impact of poor leadership may be the most detrimental. It undermines the impact you and your team can have. It impacts the care and service you provide your patients. What have you done and what are you doing to improve your leadership skills? #forpharmacy #forpharmacists #pharmacists #pharmacyleadership #leadwell #KeepPharmacistsImproving #AmericanPharmacistsMonth #EveryoneDeservesToBeLedWell

We were working with the founder of a Series A digital healthcare company focused on #valuebasedcare. After securing funding, their initial plan was to recruit several mid-market account executives to aggressively sell their platform to physicians' offices and clinics. However, this strategy often falls short. It's a familiar scenario: Secure funding, assemble a team of mid-level AEs, and hope they'll navigate the market successfully. Here's the issue: In digital healthcare, commercial leadership is paramount. You can't simply wing it when discussing value-based care and healthcare trends with doctors. You can be the smoothest talking sales person on the planet but you can't bs your way through a VBC conversation, insurances, risk models etc. You need someone who's taken a product like this to market. None of the founders possessed true commercial leadership skills. While they managed to sell the platform to large clinics through their connections from their ivy league universities, they lacked a seasoned sales leader. Selling to independent medical practices is HAAARD, ask anyone that's ever worked at Zocdoc.. What's needed is a leader who can craft effective messaging, develop a solid go-to-market (GTM) strategy, and can identify what works before expanding the team with less experienced AEs. That's why they called us and within 4 weeks, they had their CRO. Whether you're a sales leader looking to explore what's next or you need to ramp up your organization, we're here.

#hiring Center Operations Director, Los Angeles, United States, fulltime #jobs #jobseekers #careers #LosAngelesjobs #Californiajobs Apply: https://lnkd.in/eMhcj6QN Overview: Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on Indeed, that the salary rate/range set forth herein was provided by Indeed. Concentra's market specific rate/range will be provided during the interview process.Do you want to apply your skills and knowledge of operations to help improve the health of America's workforce? With a national footprint of more than 500 medical centers and more than 130 onsite clinics nationwide, Concentra colleagues are fueled by our drive to provide an exceptional experience for our customers and exceptional care for their employees. Our Center Operations Director is the vanguard of the practice, aligning with the Leadership Team to ensure standard procedures and operations are executed with precision. You are on the forefront of providing an excellent customer experience and delivering an optimal quality of health care services for the community. Responsibilities: We are in need of a leader with an ambitious spirit who acts as the face to current and prospective patients while driving the practice's success and being directly accountable for the P&L.Builds an environment of team building, integrity, patient/colleague safety, quality care, continuous improvement, reward and recognition at the center level.Monitors and drives key business and clinical metrics.Ensures staffing optimization and holds staff accountable to impact workflow and patient experience for all disciplines and sites.Works with clinicians in assessing center processes, work flows and staffing to continuously improve the patient experience.Maintains and establishes relationships with employers, payers, referral sources, networks, local communities, etc. to drive market growth.Mentors and coaches their team regarding business metrics, patient/client happiness, process and procedure, etc.Develops colleague success through all aspects of the talent life cycle including recruiting, hiring, onboarding, orientation, mentoring / development, engagement, retention, performance management and succession planning. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experienceTwo to three years of supervisory experience preferredStrong service mentality and a focus on achieving defined service standardsConsiderate and supporting communication style; warm, positive, upbeat demeanorAbility to lead and prioritize multiple tasks at a time in a dynamic environment without direct supervisionAbility to identify areas of opportunity, develop a plan of action to improve, implement and evaluate plan effectively Additional Data: The experience you will gain is limitless, as are the career advantages. In addition to a full medical plan with a 401

3 Reasons why you need to be following Gedeon Richter Australia üöÄDIRECTION They have invested in being DATA enabled and are in a strong position to make fact-based decisions and move quickly into execution. üöÄTEAM BUILD Over the next 6 months we will be working towards leveraging that data to build a Women‚Äôs Health focused company in ANZ, meeting some of the biggest unmet needs for women and their families. We have exciting new launches that will positively impact the lives of thousands of women affected by conditions that have had no new treatment for many years. To bring about that impact we will be on a recruitment drive nationally for GP Sales, Nurse Educators and Sales Leaders. Yes, we will be going against the norms and investing in growing a GP team. We know our targets and we know how to engage them, now we need to build the team. So, Rookies, Experienced Reps and Sales Leaders, take note, attitude will override experience, curious minds that want to experience a different approach and grow, we want to hear from you. Curious, connect with James Webb, Glen Pearce or myself Charles Heeley üöÄPARTNERSHIP OPPORTUNITY In line with growing their presence in the GP sector with a promotional field force, we are also looking for partners to complement our portfolio. We are looking for additional product lines that are promotional sensitive to in-license or co-promote into our portfolio. We are open to exploring how we can partner with you for joint growth. Please connect with me Charles Heeley directly to explore potential collaboration opportunities. CONNECT and FOLLOW üëáüëáüëáüëáüëáüëáüëáüëá Gedeon Richter Australia are going to be a Women‚Äôs Health leader, connected to their patients. Connect and follow to part of the evolution. #womenshealth #talent #growth #partnerships #recruitment #opportunity
